page.title: 04HOUSING continued
page.content: ARCHITECTURAL SURVEY of Buckland Common. Pre-WW1 housing continued: interest were the planks of old wood between the jutting out sections of roof and the upper windows. Another type of pre-WW1 building was the Cholesbury Village Hall built in 1895.It had rectangular windows with rounded tops.Much smaller than the earlier Victorian house,it was surrounded by railings.The tiled roof was also bumpy with sections of roof again overlapping the windows. Modern housing: An outstanding modern house was found in the area dating from the 1960s.It had a garage,red brick walls,a boundary wall with patterns on the top,and a porch with pillars.
